author: pdobacz
content:
There is a new release of EOF EEST tests - v2.3.0. This is planned to be the last eof-devnet-0 release, from now on we will be moving forward with merging the changes for eof-devnet-1 spec

https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/eip7692%40v2.3.0

We encourage teams to still update to this release before working on devnet-1, as it features a lot of new coverage, which would be good to be green before introducing the breaking devnet-1 changes :).

Pls report passing of the tests as usual

author: acolytec3
content: Is there a specific fuzzer application (or flag in the EEST framework) that I can try running our t8n implementation against?  I've got a draft of the EIP-7756 tracing ready to go and I am getting seemingly good results from the traces produced when running EOF tests

author: _shemnon
content: My fuzzer uses the outputs of EEST, not t8n.

author: acolytec3
content: ah, ok, so is it something that normies can run off the output from `--traces` in EEST?  I mainly just want to see if we're formatting the trace fields correctly, etc.

author: _shemnon
content: Yes, that's typically how I develop tests.

author: _shemnon
content:
my typical test shell script for test development
```
rm -rf debug/besu_dev
mkdir debug/besu_dev

if [[ $1 =~ 'tests/' ]]
then
  TESTS=${1}
  shift
else
  TESTS=tests/osaka/eip7692_eof_v1/
fi

uv run fill \
  --fork=Osaka \
  --t8n-dump-dir  debug/besu_dev \
  -v \
  $TESTS \
  --evm-bin $HOME/git/shemnon/besu/build/install/besu/bin/evmtool  \
  --evm-dump-dir  debug/besu_dev \
  -traces \
  --html=debug/besu_dev/report-osaka.html \
  > debug/besu_dev/res.txt \
  2> debug/besu_dev/err.txt
```
